Steve Jobs

American inventor, designer and entrepreneur who was the co-founder, chief executive and chairman of Apple Computer


Steve Jobs was an Amercian entrepreneur, industrial designer, investor and media proprietor. Jobs was the chief executive officer (CEO), chairman and co-founder of Apple Inc., the chairman and majority shareholder of Pixar, a member of The Walt Disney company's board of director's following its procurement of Pixar, and the founder, chairman and CEO of NeXT. Steve Jobs is widely recognised as a pioneer of the personal computer revolution of the 1970's and 1980's, together with his early business partner and fellow Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak.

Timeline of Steve Job's Life

  • 1995 - Steve Jobs was born on the 24th of February 1995 to Abdulfattah Jandali and Joanne Schieble, who then gave him up for adoption, where he was adopted by Paul and Clara Jobs.
  • 1960 - Jobs moved to Mountain View in Clara County, California with this family.
  • 1969 - Jobs met Steve Wozniak who was five years older than him, but they both shared a love for electronics.
  • 1973 - Jobs attended Reed College, but dropped out after one semster. He moved to a hippie commune after dropping out. Jobs later takes a job working for Atari.
  • 1976 - Jobs and Wozniak show the first board for the Apple I at the Homebrew Computer Club. On April 1st, Jobs, Wozniak and Ron Wayne incorporate as Apple Computer.
  • 1977 - Apple Computer is continuing to grow and they show the Apple II at the West Coast Computer Fair.
  • 1980 - Apple Computer went on the stock market, making Jobs, already successful, and exceptionally wealthy
  • 1984 - The Macintosh was introduced at the Apple shareholders meeting.
  • 1985 - After Jobs was ousted from Apple, he,along with some other individuals from Apple, founded NeXT.
  • 1986 - Jobs bought the computer animation division of George Lucas' ILM and incorporates it as Pixar.
  • 1989 - Jobs was named entrepreneur of the decade by Inc. Magazine.
  • 1996 - Apple bought the NeXT operating system and took Jobs back onboard as an advisor and he returned to his former role as CEO in July 1997.
  • 2001 - Apple successfully released the first iPod in 2001.
  • 2003 - Jobs was diagnosed with Pancreatic Cancer.
  • 2007 - Jobs introduced a product very closely associated with Apple today, the iPhone.
  • 2009 - Jobs had a liver transplant and took a medical leave of absense.
  • 2010 - Jobs announced the release of the first tablet, the iPad, and the improved iPhone, the iPhone 4.
  • 2011 - On August 24, 2011, Jobs resigned from Apple, handing the reigns to Tim Cook as this health had worsened. Steve Jobs died at home on October 5, 2011, surrounded by his family.

If you want to find out more information about Steve Job's Life, read this Wikipedia entry.
